page.title: 02ECOLOGY LOUGH NEAGH
page.content: {LOUGH NEAGH ECOLOGY: {BIRD LIFE:}The majority of Lough Neaghs mid winter wildfowl population consists of ducks which dive for their food.Examples of these are Pochard,Tufted duck and Goldeneye.They rely mainly on the larvae of the Lough Neagh fly for their food.Swans are to be found in sheltered areas. {FISH: }Eels can be found in Lough Neagh.They feed on algae,fly larvea and other planktonic creatures. Salmon arrive in Lough Neagh in early June on their way to the river and streams to spawn. Pollen or freshwater Herring are not as popular for the fisherman as they were before 1900. Lough Neagh trout or dollaghan are not now as plentiful as they once were. Roach have recently been introduced into the Lough Neagh basin.
